main event: A civilian pilot spotted a slow-moving, amber-colored, round object in the sky over Columbia, Missouri in 1967.
interesting points: The object was 5-6 times brighter than Venus and slightly larger and higher in the sky.
The object remained stationary and did not move like an airplane.
The observer was a highly experienced pilot and licensed radio engineer with the Air Force Reserve.
The Air Force investigated the sighting and concluded it was likely a satellite, but could not confirm this.
